casebody.data:
NEUSOFT MEDICAL SYSTEMS, USA, INC., Plaintiff
v.
NEUISYS, LLC, Defendant
Neuisys, LLC, Counterclaim-Plaintiff
v.
Neusoft Medical Systems, USA, Inc., Tom Buse, and Keith Mildenburger, Counterclaim-Defendants
Neuisys, LLC, Third-Party Plaintiff
v.
Neusoft Medical System Company, Ltd., Third-Party Defendant. No. 288P15. Supreme Court of North Carolina. Nov. 5, 2015. Alan W. Duncan, Attorney at Law, for Neusoft Medical System Company, Ltd. Stephen M. Russell, Jr., Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for Neusoft Medical System Company, Ltd. L. Cooper Harrell, Greensboro, Attorney at Law. Daniel R. Taylor, Jr., Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, For Neusoft Medical Systems, USA Inc. Susan H. Boyles, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for Neusoft Medical Systems, USA Inc. J. Dennis Bailey, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for Buse, Tom, et al. Joseph T. Carruthers, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for Buse, Tom, et al. Greer B. Taylor, Attorney at Law. Philip J. Mohr, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for Neuisys, LLC. Brent F. Powell, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law, for Neuisys, LLC. Jon Berkelhammer, Attorney at Law, for North Carolina Association of Defense Attorneys. Matthew W. Sawchak, Raleigh, Attorney at Law, for North Carolina Association of Defense Attorneys. Kelly Margolis Dagger, Raleigh, Attorney at Law, for North Carolina Association of Defense Attorneys. Phillip Absolom Harris, Jr., Raleigh, Attorney at Law, for Neusoft Medical Systems, USA Inc.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 11th of August 2015 by Plaintiff and Counterclaim Defendant's (Neusoft Medical Systems, USA, Inc.) in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 5th of November 2015."
